div.p: S. D. For a long time, I have not received any letters from your kindness, most illustrious man, and therefore I await them with great longing. The one who delivers this letter to you, Maternus, etc., is a learned and pious man; he spent some time in Wittenberg, then went to Geneva, returned to us, and was for some time a companion of Mr. Peter Martyr; now he is going to Italy to see it as well.

He asked me for recommendations; I could not refuse him, as I consider him worthy, whom all the pious should love and whom all good people should help. You can assist him with recommendations and advice.

You will do here, as I know, more than I ask and so that I understand that our recommendation has had some weight with you. During these winter months, I wrote 6 books against the Anabaptists in German; they contain pages... therefore I could not conveniently attach them to the letters nor fit them into... the pocket. We are in good health by the singular grace of God.

All of ours greet you; greet [the father with our sons]. On March 18, the Abbey of St. Gall was completely consumed by fire, which started in the house of a certain pastor. Yesterday, our most honorable council sent an envoy there to console the afflicted and to give a gift of 200 crowns. May the Lord be with them and strengthen them in good.

Throughout Germany, we hear that soldiers have been conscripted for some time, but today we hear they have been dismissed and are to be dismissed. I cannot write more as I am tired; I have spent 5 whole days writing letters, for today Froschauer left for Frankfurt. Live and farewell with your whole household, with our John, and especially with Father Travers.
Hector is struggling with poor health.
To the most illustrious man Mr. Friedrich von Salis, most worthy commissioner of the County of Chiavenna, his most esteemed lord and dearest brother. Chiavenna in Valtellina.
